definition: 7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: A: Good afternoon, Madam. May I help you?
sentences.chinese: 午安，太太，我可以幫你嗎？

sentences.english: Good afterwardsapex. This is Dan An Commercial Bank. What can I do for you?
sentences.chinese: 午安。這裏是大安貿易銀行。我能爲你服務嗎？

sentences.english: Good afternoon. This is Dan An Commercial Bank. What can I do for you?
sentences.chinese: 午安。這裏是大安貿易銀行。我能爲您效能嗎？

sentences.english: If you can not meet tomorrow , so good morning, good afternoon, good night.
sentences.chinese: 如果明天不能見面，那麼早安，午安，晚安。
午安，太太，我可以幫你嗎？

sentences.english: Good afternoon, Mr. Kono. I'll contact Mr. Harris and let him know you've arrived.
sentences.chinese: 午安，河野先生，我會聯絡海瑞先生，告訴他您到了。
午安，瑪麗。生意做得怎麼樣？

sentences.english: Good afternoon, sir, how are you today?
Good afternoon, gentlemen. Mr. Sonoda has been looking forward to your arrival.
sentences.chinese: 各位先生午安，園田先生一直盼望着您們抵達。

sentences.english: Good afternoon, Sir. Can I help you?
sentences.chinese: 午安，先生。我能幫您什麼嗎？

sentences.english: Good afternoon. It's a pleasure to finally meet you.
sentences.chinese: 兩位午安，很高興終於與您們會面了。

sentences.english: Good morning. This is Chengtai Trading Company. May I advice you?
sentences.chinese: 午安。這裏是大安貿易銀行。我能爲你服務嗎？

sentences.english: Good afternoon. Can I get a room in the Hotel please?
sentences.chinese: 午安，我想在你們這邊訂一間客房？

sentences.english: Good afternoon, we would like to contract two stenographers for the coming week.
sentences.chinese: 午安，下週我們約訂兩名速記員。

definition: see you tomorrow/(coll., jocular) food that passes through the digestive system more or less intact (esp. enoki mushrooms)
(loanword) bye-bye/also pr. [bai1 bai1] etc/(coll.) to part ways (with sb)/(fig.) to have nothing further to do (with sb or sth)
to pay one's respects by bowing with hands in front of one's chest clasping joss sticks, or with palms pressed together/(Tw) religious ceremony in which offerings are made to a deity
